person.note: Liu(2) Zhi [8089] Posthumously purged as Yuanyou coalition member. Qi's [3583] father. According to his funerary inscription for Chen Xiaobiao's wife, born Li, she was the wife of Zhi's mother's brother, which means that Liu Zhi's father was the son-in-law of Chen Xiaobiao's father. Affinal relation of Tian(1) Ziliang [1619]. Xiang(2) Ziyin [715] was the father-in-law of Zhi's grandson and Qi's son, Changfu [3581]. Xiang(2) Ziyin's [715] grandson-in-law, Liu(2) Xun [3593], was Zhi's great grandson. Qi's sons and Zhi's other descendants had moved to Linjiang, Qingjiang xian with the fall of the Northern Song. Liu(2) Changli [3582], the son-in-law of Cai(1) Kang's [1653] grandnephew, Fan [3857], had the same generational name as Zhi's grandsons and Qi's sons. Liu(2) Qi composed Cai(1) Fan's funerary inscription. Zhi's sixth generation descendant, Liu(2) Zhensun [3591], was Guangdong tiju in 1255 and was Wei(5) Liaoweng's [4001] son-in-law. Zhi was initially a friend of Yang(2) Wei(2) [2032], but was later attacked by him. Guangdong TZ, 16.13a. CBD, 5, 3894-6.

desc.label: 四遷入內副都知 元祐初 御史劉摯言其筦皇城十年 縱遣邏者 恣為殘刻
紹聖初 復為御史中丞 極論呂大防、劉摯、梁燾垂簾時事、乞正典刑 又言司馬光變更先朝已行之法為罪 徽宗立
用為編修三司條例官 哲宗初知樞密院事 劉摯、蘇轍等交章擊之 黜知汝州 高太后崩
以治行稱 遷御史裏行 王安石一見器異之 顧者不附安石 竟上疏極論新法之弊
